alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT NORTH CENTRAL CAMDEN... AND NORTHERN CURRITUCK COUNTIES...THE SOUTHERN CITY OF NORFOLK...THE CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 1229 PM EDT, radar indicated strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Corolla to near Currituck to near Northwest. Movement was north at 35 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph and locally heavy downpours are possible with these storms. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Back Bay, Fentress, Ghent, Bowers Hill, Corolla, Northwest and Cradock. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
